column4: I need some help with "systemconfigurator --runboot". It says "Error: None of the following bootloaders were successfully setup on your system: YaBoot,Iseries,EFI,Elilo,Lilo,Grub,Palo,Aboot,ZIPL,Kboot", but I obviously have Grub installed.
it may be not set to handle 'grub2' thats the default in ubuntu now
and that program may not support grub2... Ive never used systemconfigurator
You need to have  the disk partioned in a way that windows has a space tio install to.
you have just linux on the machine now?
Any program I could burn and boot from a disk?
then you need to resize your partitions and make a unallocated space for windows to format/install to. gparted can do that.
What if I want to remove linux completely, a fresh start?
then delete all partitions. and reboot windows installer cd.
So are you telling me to start Gparted while I've booted from my linux HDD?
yes. or use a live cd.
if you want to delete linux and install windows. You basically erase the HD and let windows repartition it.. windows instller can proberly do it also.
The windows installer has the Format option but it's gray, not clickable
delete the partitons via gparted then i guess.
